title: Sheridan Smith slams claims she 'lashed out at child actors' in Joseph
text:
Sheridan plays as the narrator (Picture: Dan Wooller/REX)

Sheridan Smith has slammed claims she was axed from West End musical Joseph and the Amazing Technicolour Dreamcoat for ‘lashing out’ at the child actors.

The actress, who plays the narrator in the show, took to Instagram to deny losing her temper during the final performance’s after-party and shouted at fellow cast members, some of whom are between 11 to 13 years old.

Responding to the claims in an Instagram post on Sunday, Sheridan wrote: ‘The story today is completely untrue, the kids in the show were the only reason I stayed the whole run.

‘I love every single one of them and the kids and their parents became family.

‘Also I never ever went to a single party as I am in recovery so this is all fabricated, vicious, cruel lies… All my love Sheridan x.’

She also captioned the post: ‘The moment I saw the headline I just thought what a load of bull! You’re bloody brilliant and I cannot wait to see you tomorrow onboard the Stages Festival cruise!!!’

A source told The Sun that the 38-year-old attended London Palladium’s VIP bar with her fiancé Jamie Horn before shouting and ‘lashing out’ at the kids.

Sheridan also played in Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps (Picture: Matt Crossick/PA Wire)

They said: ‘Starring in a West End show can be very intense and while she never put a foot wrong on stage, away from it she could often be quite up and down.

‘After the final show, bosses held a party in the theatre’s VIP bar and Sheridan was there with her fiancé Jamie Horn.

‘They were chilling out, while a group of the younger cast were messing around nearby. Suddenly Sheridan turned around and very rudely told them to go away.’

Despite the rumours, the BAFTA-winning actress’ stint was always meant to be once-off.

But it looks like Sheridan won’t have anything to worry about as fans quickly came to her defence.

One user commented: ‘Knew it didn’t sound like you xx.’

Another fan wrote: ‘Support you always!! YOU got this!! People can be so cruel but for every ‘hater’ their are loads of supporters ready to champion YOU!! Kindness always wins!! Take good care of yourself super and continue to shine bright let your speckle be seen!! Xxx [sic]’.
